Bromas y Chistes

üîë Key Distinctions (Diferencias Clave)

Chiste vs. Broma

  • Chiste: Es una broma comunicativa (verbal). Se cuenta.
  • Broma: Normalmente es m√°s f√≠sica (una acci√≥n). Se hace o se gasta.

ü§£ Actions & Verbs (Acciones)

  • Contar un chiste :: To tell a joke (verbal/story).
  • Bromear :: To joke around / banter.
  • Gastar bromas (o hacer bromas) :: To play pranks.
    • Nota: "Gastar" is very common in Spain for pranks.
  • Echarse a re√≠r :: To burst out laughing / To start laughing suddenly.
  • Hacer gracia (algo a alguien) :: To be funny to someone / To amuse.
    • Ex: "No me hace gracia" (I don't find it funny).

ü§° Idioms & Phrases (Modismos)

Tomar el pelo (a alguien)

  • Definition: To pull someone's leg / To tease or trick someone playfully.
  • Context: Literally "to take the hair."
  • Example: En el zoo tomaron el pelo a unos turistas pensando que el gorila pod√≠a pintar.

‚ö†Ô∏è Types of Jokes & Reactions

  • Bromista :: Prankster / Joker (The person who makes the jokes).
  • Broma pesada :: Practical joke / Heavy prank.
    • Nuance: Una broma sin gusto. Puede implicar burlarse (mocking) y humillar (humiliating).
  • Darse un susto :: To get a scare / To be startled (often the result of a prank).
  • Extra√±ar (algo, a alguien) :: To miss someone OR to find something strange/surprising.

Chiste :: A communicative/verbal joke. Broma :: Usually a physical joke/prank. Tomar el pelo :: To pull someone's leg. Broma pesada :: A tasteless/heavy prank (can be humiliating). Echarse a re√≠r :: To burst out laughing.
